reviewText: Fall of Gyes is a visual mess.  In many scenes - particularly action scenes - you often can't tell who's saying what, or what is happening to whom.  Some of the speech bubbles pop up in the wrong order.  If you're looking for the kind of VN that offers choices, you won't find any here.  Also, the whole 'novel' is shorter than this review.

reviewText: Nice scifi story with cool illustrations and emerging audio.\nAs its backer, I'm glad I help to make that piece of art a reality.\nKeep up with the After Reset!

Well, this novel is not as bad as some say. I also have a comic that was attached to the pre-order Witcher 3 and he was worse (primitive story, ordinary drawing), and their comparison in favor of Gyes.
As concept art enthusiast, I keep track of Adam Burn works and I want to say that this is not his best creation. But compared with the vast majority of comics that I've met, TFOG stands out for its beauty and enough conceived. The style of drawing is quite unusual, but I like it. It's rare to meet realistic style in comics.
A small complaint I can make on the text - it would like to have more. Maybe, any kind of lore datalogs or interludes between important parts of novel? Flashbacks? Minds of characters? Just as text, I don't need too much pictures.
But I did not have a sense of disappointment, rather I wanted to AR RPG quickly released and wanted to meet with Bella during walkthrough. Still interesting what role it will play in the game's story and what events will take place in New Dallass. I think, there coming some kind of zombie-apocalypse, funny to see this in classis RPG...
In th end, this comics fulfilled his main task - he attracts in the After Reset world and showed a small piece of his background. I can honestly say that I liked it.

reviewText: This is a nice primer for the world of After Reset - and as a backer of AR, I was glad to finally get to see some of the game´s world closer! Drawback: now can´t wait until AR comes out :D\n\nEspecially liked the sound effects throughout the novel which really support the mood (hope in AR they will be on par, quality-wise!), and the ..well.. can´t say what without spoiling :) Just check it out if you got like 15 - 30 mins of time (depending how fast you read and how long you spend to appreciate each panel). Don´t expect Hours of story" thou - this IS a small intro/teaser into the world - but one that leaves you waiting for the main game to come out
date: so definitely does it´s job. So it´s worth it if you like graphic novels
recommended: are interested in the After Reset universe
hoursPlayed: or generally are into dark sci-fi stuff and cool concept art / drawings.\n\nBefore you click the "play the game" button
voteText: I recommend to check out the "Backstory" button - so that you know a bit about the world in which the main story takes place."
